member.name: F:Skybrud.Essentials.Locations.LocationHelper.EarthEquatorialRadiusMeters
member.summary:
Gets the equatorial radius of Earth (in meters).
Notice: When comparing with various online services, they seem to use 6378137 meters for the equatorial radius of Earth, while 6378136.6 meters for the equatorial radius is more precise.

member.param: The latitude of the first location.
The longitude of the first location.
The latitude of the second location.
The longitude of the second location.
member.returns: The distance in meters between the two locations.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.GetWhitSunday(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets the date of Whit Sunday, which is celebrated on the 7th Sunday after Easter.
Depending on the year, Whit Sunday falls within the period from the 10th of May to the 13th of June (both inclusive).
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Whit Sunday.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.GetWhitMonday(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets the date of Whit Monday, which is celebrated the day after Whit Sunday. Whit Sunday is the 7th Sunday after Easter.
Depending on the year, Whit Monday falls within the period from the 11th of May to the 14th of June (both inclusive).
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Whit Monday.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.Canada.GetCanadaDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Canada Day. Canada Day is the national day of Canada, a federal statutory holiday celebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of the Constitution Act, 1867 (then called the British North America Act, 1867), which united three colonies into a single country called Canada within the British Empire.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Canada Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.Canada.GetLabourDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Labour Day. Labour Day is a public holiday celebrated on the first Monday in September.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Labour Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.Canada.GetThanksgivingDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Thanksgiving Day. Thanksgiving Day occurs on the second Monday in October, which celebrates the harvest and other blessings of the past year.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.Denmark.GetConstitutionDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Constitution Day (Grundlovsdag in Danish). Constitution Day is observed on 5 June, and commemorates the anniversary of the signing of the Danish Constitution of 1849, which established Denmark as a constitutional monarchy, and honors the constitution of 1953, which was adopted on the same date.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Independence Day.

member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Patriot Day also known as National Day of Service and Remembrance. The day occurs on September 11 of each year in memory of the 2,977 people killed in the 2001 September 11 attacks.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.UnitedStates.GetLaborDay(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.UnitedStates.GetMemorialDay(System.Int32)

member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Memorial Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.UnitedStates.GetVeteransDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Veterans Day. Veterans Day is an official United States public holiday, observed annually on November 11, that honors military veterans, that is, persons who served in the United States Armed Forces.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Veterans Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarHelper.UnitedStates.GetThanksgivingDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing Thanksgiving Day. Thanksgiving, or Thanksgiving Day, is an important public holiday, celebrated on the fourth Thursday in November in the United States. It originated as a harvest festival. Thanksgiving has been celebrated nationally on and off since 1789, after a proclamation by George Washington.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarUtils.Canada.GetCanadaDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing the date of Canada Day. Canada Day is the national day of Canada, a federal statutory holiday celebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of the Constitution Act, 1867 (then called the British North America Act, 1867), which united three colonies into a single country called Canada within the British Empire.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Canada Day.

member.summary: Gets an instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day. Thanksgiving Day occurs on the second Monday in October, which celebrates the harvest and other blessings of the past year.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarUtils.Denmark.GetConstitutionDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing the date of Constitution Day (Grundlovsdag in Danish). Constitution Day is observed on 5 June, and commemorates the anniversary of the signing of the Danish Constitution of 1849, which established Denmark as a constitutional monarchy, and honors the constitution of 1953, which was adopted on the same date.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Constitution Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarUtils.UnitedStates.GetLaborDay(System.Int32)

member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Memorial Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarUtils.UnitedStates.GetVeteransDay(System.Int32)

member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Veterans Day.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Essentials.Time.CalendarUtils.UnitedStates.GetThanksgivingDay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day. Thanksgiving, or Thanksgiving Day, is an important public holiday, celebrated on the fourth Thursday in November in the United States. It originated as a harvest festival. Thanksgiving has been celebrated nationally on and off since 1789, after a proclamation by George Washington.
member.returns: An instance of representing the date of Thanksgiving Day.
